CPC Dual Fuel Studyreading some applicable for Florida Steve Forwarded by Steven KrimskyCorpEnron on AM Samantha Slater on AM To cc Subject CPC Dual Fuel Study As promised Samantha Samantha M Slater Manager of State Regional Affairs Electric Power Supply Association H Street NW Suite Washington DC Phone Fax Email NewEnglandNGRptpdf

RE FW Attached Files Cc aware that the Broward County Tax Appraiser will assess the proper ty and that as most industrial facilities the equipment is subject to depreciation The Citys millage rate has remained fairly constant sta gnant growth butas the tax base increases they expect the millage rate to decrease The City is looking for a fixed annual revenue stream of mm similar to Pompanos mm After we have all had a chance to review the doc it would be good to have a conference call to discuss Were targetting to get a draft to the City early next week Steve Original Message From Jacoby Ben Sent Thu AM To TLAW NRON Krimsky Steven Cc Mann Kay Subject RE FW Attached Files Ad valorems do not necessarily decrease as a result of depreciation becaus e millage rates and a current years reassessment also are part of the calculation Have they asked for this Original Message From TLAW NRON mailtoIMCEANOTESOrshefskyDGTLAWEcom NRONcom Sent Thursday May AM To Jacoby Ben Krimsky Steven Cc Mann Kay TLAWcom Subject Re FW Attached Files We wanted to maintain a recurring mm and since ad advalorems will decrease as a function of depreciation we thought the way to maintain the constant we to increase the k at the same rate as the depreciation Sent from my BlackBerry Wireless Handheld wwwBlackBerrynet The information contained in this transmission may contain privileged and confidential information It is intended only for the use of the persons named above If you are not the intended recipient you are hereby notified that any review dissemination distribution or duplication of this communication is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient please contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the original message To reply to our email administrator directly please send an email to

RE Deerfield development agreement Cc with your Kays comments Section Free Opiton is nothing more than a wish the City put on the tab le for the first time this past Wednesday They have no intention of creat ing a utility nor do they envision being a power marketer I agree omit it from the draft The City is envisioning there is a possiblity the facilty will be expanded in the future which is what Coastal has beendiscussing with them regardin g their phased SCCC approach and as such is willing to have future expansion language in the doc Debbies bThe Citys position is that there are no guarantees the facility will be given the approvals in the future for expansion new commission change of law etc and that the language might be of some benefit Should we elect to remain quiet the y will agree The City is looking for an initial up front payment of mm this Septembe r which was Pompanos initial position as well another wishful thought I agree with the proposed changes to prior to the end of the calendar ye ar in which DBEC received its building permit the payment will be made Steve Original Message From Jacoby Ben Sent Wed PM To Mann Kay Krimsky Steven Cc Subject RE Deerfield development agreement Kay Steve Attached are my comments Ive tried to address Kays concerns below and agree with them wholeheartedly From a commercial perspective paragraph is a nonstarter Lets discuss Thanks Ben ENRONDEERFIELD AGREEMENT markedDOC Original Message From Mann Kay Sent Wednesday May PM To Krimsky Steven Jacoby Ben Subject Deerfield development agreement Here are my initial comments Theres no clear triggering event which would expedite the internal approv al process For instance paragraph is a current obligation re landscaping It would be easier to process this agreement if the effectiveness of this agreement commences when we file for a building permit I understand that we would have to pay some of this prior to th e time the permit is issued but again magic words help Paragraph on right of first refusal for power Looks like a free cal l for the next years Just want to make sure youve bought in on this Other than the obvious valuation impact it could impact a purchasers ability to obtain project financing Kay

RE Pompano dev agsite plan approvalresulted in the generation of the Dev Order Sorry about the delayed response Ive been having major email problems as a result of the mirgration over to Outlook Look forward to discussing the agreements Monday at EST Steve Original Message From Mann Kay Sent Thu PM To Krimsky Steven Jacoby Ben Cc Subject Pompano dev ag Hi there Is the site plan approval a different document than the development order Thanks Kay

Deerfield Development Review Committee Hearing June thplan to attend the hearing next Monday the th at pm at Deerfield Beach City Hall Should everything go well this will be the only public hearing in Deerfield We will be getting with each of you regarding presentational material etc Also please plan to attend a premeeting atKeith Associates Monday a t am Regards Steve

FW Deerfield Beach Energy Centeris the Citys redline against our draft I will call to discuss Steve Original Message From Andy Maurodis ENRON Sent Thu AM To Cc Krimsky Steven Jacoby Ben Subject Deerfield Beach Energy Center attached is revised agreement staff presently reviewing Please acknowledge receipt Andy Maurodis PB DOC PB DOC PB DOC

Pompano Commission Hearing Cc to attend the hearing next Tuesday the th at pm at Pompa no Beach City Hall This will be the rd hearing for the FirstReading The hearing is expected to cover Citys consultant will present its revised report Enron will provide its rebuttal Commission will ask questions then deliberate and vote Ifapproved the Commission will schedule thend Reading final ap proval which most likely will occur at the next regularly scheduled meeting on Jun e Please plan to attend a premeeting at Keith Associates Tuesday at pm Regards Steve

RE Deerfield Beach Energy Center sections and Cc After our call we had a few morediscussions with the City regarding th e guarantee etc We think we have them convinced that the only gurantee Enron North America will provide is a payment obligation for Section mm u p through issuance of the building permits Debbie will draft accordingl y The City would like the base document agreed to and signed by DBEC on Monda y am the th prior to the DRC hearing at pm and will allow the opinio ns and guarantee to follow Their only request is that the opinions and guarantee besubmitted well in advance of theCommission Hearing sch eduled for pm onthe th so as to have sufficient time to review and com ment morning of the th should work The City is insisting the initial payment of k needs to occur before it s fiscal yearend Sept Debbie will revise accordingly Debbie will issue a new draft tonight lets plan todiscuss it tomorrow am Regards Steve Original Message From Mann Kay Sent Thu PM To TLAWcom Cc Jacoby Ben TLAWcom Krimsky Steven Subject RE Deerfield Beach Energy Center sections and Default By DBEC Should DBEC default on the payment obligations containe d herein it shall be liable for interest on the amount outstanding at a rate of one and onehalf percent per month or each portion thereof Shou ld the City of Deerfield Beech obtain enforcement of the payment obligations contained herein through judicial action then in that event the City of Deerfield Beech shall be reimbursed by the DBEC for all costs and attorneys fees including the costs of any appeals Default By the City of Deerfield Beech Should the City of Deerf ield Beech default on the obligations contained herein and DBEC obtain enforcement of any rights or obligations set forth herein through judic ial action then in that event DBEC shall be reimbursed by the City of Deerfield Beech for all costs and attorneys fees including the costs of any appeals

RE DOAH consolidationThat works for me Original Message From Mann Kay Sent Wednesday November PM To Krimsky Steven Jacoby Ben Subject DOAH consolidation Hi there We need to get to closure on how to respond to motion to consolidate and how to deal with the vs issue on Deerfield Shall we try again for a conference call later today Karri is available up until pm Central Thanks Kay

RE Deerfield development agreement Cc I agree with your Kays comments Section Free Opiton is nothing more than a wish the City put on the table for the first time this past Wednesday They have no intention of creating a utility nor do they envision being a power marketer I agree omit it from the draft The City is envisioning there is a possiblity the facilty will be expanded in the future which is what Coastal has been discussing with them regarding their phased SCCC approach and as such is willing to have future expansion language in the doc Debbies b The Citys position is that there are no guarantees the facility will be given the approvals in the future for expansion new commission change of law etc and that the language might be of some benefit Should we elect to remain quiet they will agree The City is looking for an initial up front payment of mm this September which was Pompanos initial position as well another wishful thought I agree with the proposed changes to prior to the end of the calendar year in which DBEC received its building permit the payment will be made Steve Original Message From Jacoby Ben Sent Wed PM To Mann Kay Krimsky Steven Cc Subject RE Deerfield development agreement Kay Steve Attached are my comments Ive tried to address Kays concerns below and agree with them wholeheartedly From a commercial perspective paragraph is a nonstarter Lets discuss Thanks Ben ENRONDEERFIELD AGREEMENT markedDOC Original Message From Mann Kay Sent Wednesday May PM To Krimsky Steven Jacoby Ben Subject Deerfield development agreement Here are my initial comments Theres no clear triggering event which would expedite the internal approval process For instance paragraph is a current obligation re landscaping It would be easier to process this agreement if the effectiveness of this agreement commences when we file for a building permit I understand that we would have to pay some of this prior to the time the permit is issued but again magic words help Paragraph on right of first refusal for power Looks like a free call for the next years Just want to make sure youve bought in on this Other than the obvious valuation impact it could impact a purchasers ability to obtain project financing Kay

FW Memo re City of Coconut Creek vs City of Deerfield BeachIts Greenbergs intent to discuss the attached during our conference call tomorrow at Steve Original Message From ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESMedleyBgtlawEcom NRONcom Sent Tuesday July PM To Krimsky Steven Subject Memo re City of Coconut Creek vs City of Deerfield Beach SKDOC Please review and let us know when you send this out to others so we know who has been copied on it The information contained in this transmission may contain privileged and confidential information It is intended only for the use of the persons named above If you are not the intended recipient you are hereby notified that any review dissemination distribution or duplication of this communication is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient please contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the original message To reply to our email administrator directly please send an email to SKDOC

FW Letter to Kay Mann Cc Ben Attached are GTs viewsscenarios regarding the Deerfield Coconut Creek law suit Bottom line total estimated max cost k should a trial not be required and upwards to k should a full blown trial occur GT expects to have a timeline later in the week for the various scenarios Deerfield is planning to submit the motion to dismiss tomorrow which is the day deadline The dismissal hearing is tentatively planned for August th Deerfield wants Enron to intervene as soon as possible so as to be in a position to participate in the dismissal hearing Upon Enrons request to intervene the judge typically requires business days to set the intervention hearing Working backwards assuming the dismissal hearing is scheduled for the th the intervention hearing should take place on the th at the latest which will require an intervention request be filed no later than Monday the th GT is awaiting approval to proceed and if possibly would like to file the motion to intervene on Friday Lets talk tomorrow Ill get Lorie to schedule a time Steve Original Message From ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESMedleyBgtlawEcom NRONcom Sent Wednesday August PM To Krimsky Steven Subject Letter to Kay Mann MXDOC The information contained in this transmission may contain privileged and confidential information It is intended only for the use of the persons named above If you are not the intended recipient you are hereby notified that any review dissemination distribution or duplication of this communication is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient please contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the original message To reply to our email administrator directly please send an email to MXDOC

FW Pompano Beach Energy Center Cc We are in the midst of negotiating with Coconut Creek and the other petitioners a global settlement agreement for both the Creek lawsuit and the administrative hearings for Pompano and Deerfield Assuming we are successful and the petitioners drop their request for the administrative hearings what are the remaining outstanding issues with the DEP How do you recommend we handle DEPs latest notice of change for Pompano and when do you recommend we issue our response to the change The anticipated settlement conditions are as follows only one facility will have backup fuel Enron to choose as some point in time between DBEC or PBEC while the other facility is gas only The oil use and emissions levels are per the air permit which may or may not be the same depending on the outcome of the Pompano notice of change Enron to provide a one time payment for emissions monitoring to be procured operated and maintained by DPEP BACT for the simple cycle facility basis for current permit and future conversion to combined cycle should Enron elect to convert should know the other conditions if any later in the week Steve Inline attachment follows From ENRON To Mann Kay OENRONOUNACNRECIPIENTSCNKmann Krimsky Steven OENRONOUNACNRECIPIENTSCNSkrimsk Kellermeyer Dave OENRONOUNACNRECIPIENTSCNDkelle CC Date Monday October GMT Subject Enclosed please find a draft reponse to DEPs change of position in the Pompano case Although we would normally take DEP heavily to task for its eleventhhour change of position and argue that the process cannot fairly proceed without additional procedural protections I understand that keeping the trial date is our paramount concern here Accordingly we have pulled our punches somewhat and simply try to accomplish things place all parties on notice that we will be advocating issuance of the original draft permit at the hearing we can always pull back on issues that turn out to have no consequence require DEP to clearly state for the record exactly what textual changes to the draft permit it is advocating we will also attempt to do this through discovery and sensitive the judge to the fact that we will likely need to expedite our discovery from DEP I would like to file this by midafternoon tomorrow I am travelling on Wed and would welcome your comments at your earliest possible convenience Thanks Ryan DDOC

RE FW Pompano Beach Energy Center Cc Works for me Ill arrange a call Original Message From Mann Kay Sent Tuesday October AM To Krimsky Steven ENRON Kellermeyer Dave Churbock Scott Cc Jacoby Ben Subject Re FW Pompano Beach Energy Center How about a call today at Sent from my BlackBerry Wireless Handheld wwwBlackBerrynet
